Package net.royalur.notation

Class JsonNotation

java.lang.Object
net.royalur.notation.JsonNotation
All Implemented Interfaces:
RGUNotation
public class JsonNotation extends Object implements RGUNotation
A notation that can be used to encode games of the Royal Game of Ur into JSON for serialisation. This notation has been created to be read by machines, not humans.

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • writePlayerState

      protected <P extends Piece, S extends PlayerState, R extends Roll> void writePlayerState(@Nonnull S playerState, @Nonnull RuleSet<P,S,R> rules, @Nonnull com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator generator) throws IOException
      Writes the state of a player to the JSON generator.
      Type Parameters:
      P - The type of pieces in the game.
      S - The type of player state stored in the game.
      R - The type of roll made in the game.
      Parameters:
      playerState - The state of the player to write.
      rules - The rules of the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error writing the JSON.

    • encodeGame

      @Nonnull public <P extends Piece, S extends PlayerState, R extends Roll> String encodeGame(@Nonnull Game<P,S,R> game)
      Description copied from interface: RGUNotation
      Encodes the given game, game, into text.
      Specified by:
      encodeGame in interface RGUNotation
      Type Parameters:
      P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board.
      S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
      R - The type of rolls that may be made.
      Parameters:
      game - The game to be encoded.
      Returns:
      Text that represents game in this notation.

    • decodeGame

      @Nonnull public <P extends Piece, S extends PlayerState, R extends Roll> Game<P,S,R> decodeGame(@Nonnull RuleSet<P,S,R> rules, @Nonnull String encoded)
      Description copied from interface: RGUNotation
      Decodes the game from the text encoded, based upon the rules rules.
      Specified by:
      decodeGame in interface RGUNotation
      Type Parameters:
      P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board.
      S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
      R - The type of rolls that may be made.
      Parameters:
      rules - The rules used to simulate the game as it is decoded.
      encoded - The text to decode into a game.
      Returns:
      The decoded game.
